    Configuration class to use with the RiotApi.

      • setAsyncRequestTimeout

        public ApiConfig setAsyncRequestTimeout(int asyncRequestTimeout)
        Sets a specified timeout value, in milliseconds, for calls in RiotApiAsync to wait at most for a response. If set to zero, asynchronous requests won't time out.

        To set the timeout for synchronous requests use setRequestTimeout(int) instead.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time for an asynchronous call to wait for a response until it times out
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the timeout value is smaller than 0

      • setDebugLevel

        public ApiConfig setDebugLevel(java.util.logging.Level debugLevel)
        Sets the debug level.
        Parameters:
        debugLevel - Debug level
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining

      • setDebugToFile

        public ApiConfig setDebugToFile(boolean debugToFile)
        Sets whether the debug log should be saved in a file.

        If debug logging to file is activated, a file named riot-api.log will be created and contain all logging messages for the level set via setDebugLevel(Level).

        Parameters:
        debugToFile - true if the debug log should be saved in a file, false otherwise
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining

      • setKey

        public ApiConfig setKey(java.lang.String key)
        Sets the api key for the Riot Api. Most endpoints require this key to be set.
        Parameters:
        key - Your api key
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the key is null

      • setMaxAsyncThreads

        public ApiConfig setMaxAsyncThreads(int maxAsyncThreads)
        Sets the maximum amount of threads for asynchronous api calls running at once. If set to zero, there is no limit.

        If you make asynchronous calls, and the current thread limit is reached, the api call will be queued and executed when resources become available.

        Parameters:
        maxAsyncThreads - Max amount of threads to run at the same time
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the limit is smaller than 0

      • setRateLimitHandler

        public ApiConfig setRateLimitHandler(RateLimitHandler rateLimitHandler)
        Sets the RateLimitHandler to take care of rate limiting. Can bet set to null to ignore rate limiting.
        Parameters:
        rateLimitHandler - RateLimitHandler instance
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining

      • setRequestTimeout

        public ApiConfig setRequestTimeout(int requestTimeout)
        Sets a specified timeout value, in milliseconds, for calls in RiotApi to wait at most for a response. If set to zero, requests won't time out.

        To set the timeout for asynchronous requests use setAsyncRequestTimeout(int) instead.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to wait for a response until a synchronous call fails
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the timeout value is smaller than 0

      • setTournamentKey

        public ApiConfig setTournamentKey(java.lang.String tournamentKey)
        Sets the tournament api key for the Riot Api. Tournament-related endpoints require this key to be set.
        Parameters:
        key - Your tournament api key
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the tournamentKey is null

      • setTournamentMockMode

        public ApiConfig setTournamentMockMode(boolean tournamentMockMode)
        Sets whether the api should redirect tournament method calls should be redirected to the TOURNAMENT-STUB endpoint.

        The TOURNAMENT-STUB endpoint provides dummy data meant for testing your app before going into production. Note that not all tournament methods are available in mock mode.

        Parameters:
        tournamentMockMode - true if tournament methods should be called in mock mode
        Returns:
        This ApiConfig object for chaining
